title: Move over Tom Cruise. Jay Leno has his own mid-air stunt
description: You won't believe this is real, but watch Jay Leno pop up outside the cockpit of a plane in flight. CNN's Jeanne Moos reveals how he did it.

title: Field of Dreams finally gets its game in Iowa
description: Is this heaven? No, It's Iowa.

title: What happened on board JetBlue's first NY-London flight
description: I've been a transatlantic avgeek  for decades, regularly flying back and forth from the US to the UK. I always welcome a new entrant into the arena, but many of the newcomers don't really have a strong business plan and their efforts don't survive the harsh economics of the North Atlantic, particularly in the winter.

title: Britney Spears' father to step down as her conservator
description: After months of public pressure from supporters of Britney Spears, Jamie Spears, the singer's father, signaled in a legal response Thursday that intends to step down as conservator of the singer's estate, according to a prepared copy of the response obtained by CNN.

title: GOP representative played a key role promoting Trump's big lie
description: CNN's Sara Murray looks how Rep. Scott Perry (R-PA) played a part in pushing Trump's big lie that the 2020 election was stolen.

title: US Justice Barrett denies request to block university's vaccine mandate
description: Justice Amy Coney Barrett declined a request to block Indiana University's vaccine mandate, signaling that similar policies going into effect amid a Covid-19 surge could pass legal muster.

title: Opinion: Biden deserves blame for the Afghanistan debacle
description: A group of religious warriors, riding on captured American military vehicles, vanquish a US-trained military, which relinquishes much of its power without a fight.

title: Man who confessed to killing his children refers to QAnon and Illuminati conspiracy theories
description: A California man confessed to killing his two young children, allegedly telling an FBI investigator he thought they were "going to grow into monsters so he had to kill them," according to a criminal complaint filed Wednesday.

title: Social media and messaging apps appeared to be shut down in Zambia on election day
description: Social media and messaging apps, including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Twitter, appeared to be shutdown in Zambia on Thursday as the country voted in presidential and parliamentary elections, according to a Facebook spokesperson.

title: JetBlue CEO shares challenges ahead of first transatlantic flight
description: CNN's Richard Quest boards JetBlue Airlines first transatlantic flight and discusses the travel challenges JetBlue CEO Robin Hayes dealt with ahead of the New York to London route's launch.

title: Chelsea re-signs Belgium star Romelu Lukaku on five-year deal in reported club-record deal
description: Chelsea has completed the signing of Belgium star Romelu Lukaku from Inter Milan on a five-year deal in a move that reunites the striker with his former club.

title: Reporter presses Pentagon spokesperson on Afghanistan mission
description: The Pentagon announced that more than 3,000 US troops will be deployed to Afghanistan as the Taliban continues to gain ground.

title: Taliban captures two key cities; Kabul increasingly cut off
description: The Taliban have captured the strategic city of Ghazni, a provincial capital on the road to Kabul, leaving the Afghan capital increasingly beleaguered and cut off from the rest of the country.

title: Analysis: This is Biden's cold-eyed judgment of US interests
description: At the end of the movie "Charlie Wilson's War," the eponymous main character is warned that the "crazies" just rolled into Kandahar -- and that the US would regret deserting Afghanistan after the Soviet withdrawal in 1989.  The scene, between Wilson, a hard-drinking Texas congressman played by Tom Hanks, and CIA case officer Gust Avrakotos, is pierced by the noise of a jet landing at Washington's National Airport -- a haunting reference to the hijacked plane attacks on September 11, 2001.

title: Olympian shares hopes for her daughter
description: The most decorated US track and field Olympian ever, Allyson Felix, talks with CNN's Kate Bolduan about her new daughter and taking a stand against Nike.

title: Two new massive dinosaur species discovered
description: Scientists have confirmed the discovery of two massive new dinosaur species in northwest China -- some of the first vertebrates uncovered in the region, according to a new study published Thursday.

title: Footage shows bear wander around Los Angeles supermarket
description: A young bear was tranquilized and transported to a safe location after wandering into a supermarket in Los Angeles.

title: Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis prove their family is actually in favor of showering
description: The Kunis-Kutcher kids took a shower, you guys.

title: Breaking soccer's greatest taboo -- but in a good way
description: Around the age of 16, I arrived at an uncomfortable conclusion: As a Manchester United fan from London, I was among the most hated demographics in English football.

title: Anderson Cooper talks to a doctor about why forgetting some things is good for you
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper talks to Dr. Scott Small about his research that explains how forgetting benefits our cognitive and creative abilities, emotional well-being and even our personal and societal health. Watch "Full Circle" Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

title: Millionaire Russian politician shoots and kills man he says he mistook for bear
description: A Russian millionaire and politician has confessed to shooting a man he says he mistook for a bear.

title: Video from space captures Aurora Australis
description: Astronauts have captured images and a timelapse video showing the Aurora Australis -- the southern lights -- from space. The colorful display is caused by strong solar wind hitting Earth's magnetic shield.

title: Section of Hadrian's Wall found under busy street during utility work
description: A previously undiscovered section of Hadrian's Wall has been found during work on a water main in the city of Newcastle, northeastern England.

title: Actress who plays Lisa in 'The Simpsons': Everyone thought the show would tank
description: Yeardley Smith, who voices Lisa Simpson on the iconic TV series "The Simpsons", speaks with CNN about her character and the show's surprising success.

title: Italy may have hit Europe's hottest day on record as anticyclone 'Lucifer' sweeps in
description: Authorities in Italy say the island of Sicily may have set an all-time heat record for Europe, hitting a temperature of 48.8 degrees Celsius (119.8 degrees Fahrenheit).

title: Mom files complaint accusing school in Atlanta of race segregation
description: Kila Posey is filing a federal complaint against Atlanta's Mary Lin Elementary School saying the school's principal is making classrooms selections based on race. CNN's John Berman spoke with Mrs. Posey and her attorney Sharese Shields.

title: John Cena posts his 'Black twin,' dubbed 'Jamal Cena'
description: No one can say John Cena doesn't pay attention to the internet.

title: Ship runs aground and splits in two in Japan
description: A Panamanian-registered ship ran aground in a northern Japan harbor, then split in two and was leaking oil, but there were no injuries among the 21 crew and the oil leak was being controlled with no signs it had reached shore, the Japan Coast Guard said.

title: Hear why this Trump supporter says he won't get the vaccine
description: CNN's Donie O'Sullivan asked supporters of former President Donald Trump in South Dakota who are attending an event organized by MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell why they refuse to get the Covid-19 vaccination.

title: Slice of Charles and Diana's 1981 wedding cake sells for 'unexpected' price
description: A slice of cake from Prince Charles and Princess Diana's 1981 wedding has been sold for the "unexpected" price of £1,850 ($2,565) at auction.

title: An Olympian got lost, nearly missed his race, then won gold. He found the volunteer who helped him.
description: It's a situation we can all relate to: You get on the wrong bus, lose track of time and come close to missing an important appointment -- or in the case of Hansle Parchment, almost don't make your semifinal in the 110 meters hurdles at the Olympic Games.

title: Biden forges ahead where Trump and Obama failed on infrastructure and Afghanistan
description: Every president since George W. Bush has said it's time to leave Afghanistan and turn to nation building at home.

title: Remember when Gwyneth Paltrow wore a red velvet suit?
description: Remember when Gwyneth Paltrow turned up at the MTV Video Music Awards wearing a luxurious red velvet suit over an unbuttoned blue shirt, her blonde hair tucked behind her ears?

title: Breakthrough Covid infections are proof that vaccines actually work
description: In most cases, a "breakthrough" means a sudden, dramatic or important discovery. With Covid-19, however, the expression has been used to describe an infection that "broke" through the protective immunity of the vaccine -- and this is sometimes misinterpreted as a sign the vaccine is not working.

title: Sexual violence against women and girls in Ethiopia's Tigray region amount to war crimes, Amnesty says
description: Troops and militias aligned with the Ethiopian government have subjected hundreds of women and girls to sexual violence in Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region, according to a new report by Amnesty International.

title: What do the Taliban's gains really mean? Foreign policy expert explains
description: In less than a week, the Taliban has overrun a quarter of Afghanistan's provincial capitals in a huge swathe of territory across the north of the country. CNN's Kim Brunhuber speaks with Ashley Jackson, Co-Director at the Centre for the Study of Armed Groups at the Overseas Development Institute to understand what the militant group's gains mean.

title: Twitter blocks Indian opposition accounts for revealing identity of child allegedly raped and murdered
description: India's main opposition party is accusing Twitter of stifling freedom of speech after the company took action against hundreds of tweets that identified the family of a child who was allegedly raped and murdered.

title: These African athletes made history at Tokyo 2020
description: The Tokyo 2020 Olympics provided plenty of highlights and historical moments, many of which came from athletes representing African countries.

title: Eight feared dead in helicopter crash in Russia's Far East
description: Eight people were feared dead after a helicopter carrying 16 people, most of them tourists, crashed in a lake on the Kamchatka peninsula in Russia's Far East on Thursday.

title: Zambia starts voting in presidential election seen as too close to call
description: Zambians started voting on Thursday in a showdown between President Edgar Lungu and main opposition rival Hakainde Hichilema that looks too tight to call and comes amid mounting debt and a flagging economy.

title: Two-time NBA champion heads to college with eyes set on playing golf
description: "They always told me I could go back (to school) whenever. So, this is whenever."

title: Fear and resentment reign in Afghanistan as the Taliban overruns more cities
description: • Analysis: Biden forges ahead where Trump and Obama failed on Afghanistan and infrastructure

title: This startup is creating 'real' dairy, without cows
description: We've grown used to oat milk and soya milk — now a food-tech startup is taking alternative milk to the next level.

title: One of India's most famous designers is teaming up with H&M
description: Sabyasachi is a household name in India and its diaspora. Brides dream of wearing the luxury designer's saris and lehengas, and Bollywood celebrities are frequently spotted in his designs. He created one of Priyanka Chopra Jonas's traditional wedding outfits. And starting this week, consumers will be able to buy Sabyasachi at H&M.

title: Ghostly rings found around a black hole
description: Black holes are one the universe's ultimate mysteries, hard to even imagine. But thanks to a recently released NASA image, we can visualize one a little bit better now.

title: At least 13 dead and dozens trapped after landslide hits highway in northern India
description: At least 10 people have died and dozens are still trapped after a landslide caused rocks and heavy boulders to crash onto a highway in the northern Indian state of Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday.

title: China's get-tough approach to big business will continue for years
description: China's big crackdown on business appears far from over.

title: Australian Olympians forced to undergo 'double quarantine' of almost a month on return home
description: Australian Olympic athletes returning from Tokyo to South Australia via Sydney will be forced to undergo a double quarantine of 28 days, a mandate that has been described as "cruel and uncaring" by the country's Olympic Committee.

title: $600 million gone: Biggest crypto theft in history
description: Hackers have stolen some $600 million in cryptocurrency from the decentralized finance platform Poly Network, in what it says is the largest theft in the industry's history.

title: Philippine vaccination hubs open 24 hours as Delta threat grows
description: Vaccination centers across the Philippine capital Manila are trying to speed up inoculation rates, including by staying open 24 hours, to help combat a sharp rise in Covid-19 infections linked to the spread of the highly contagious Delta variant.

title: New Zealand to slowly re-open to the world but maintain 'zero Covid' strategy
description: New Zealand will open its doors to vaccinated travelers from low risk countries from early 2022, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announced Thursday, signaling a tentative relaxation of the country's strict pandemic border controls.

title: GOP tries to deflect blame for Covid-19 misinformation
description: Some members of the Republican party are attempting to blame the Covid-19 case surge on immigration while experts claim it is due to low vaccination rates and the Delta variant. CNN's Joe Johns reports.

title: Outraged protesters harass parent outside school board mask vote
description: Watch protestors threaten a fellow parent who supports mask mandates after a school board meeting in Williamson County, Tennessee ended with a vote for a temporary mask requirement.

title: Picasso works displayed in Las Vegas restaurant could fetch over $100M
description: Eleven Pablo Picasso artworks that were on display at a Las Vegas restaurant for over 20 years will hit the auction block this October, just two days before what would have been the artist's 140th birthday.

title: Indonesian army says it has stopped invasive 'virginity tests' on female cadets
description: The Indonesian army has ended a controversial practice of virginity tests on women who apply to become cadets, according to its chief of staff, a move welcomed by activists who have long campaigned against it.

title: North Korea issues warning to US and South Korea
description: A senior North Korean official has denounced South Korea over its joint military exercises with the United States, which are due to begin this week, warning that such actions risked provoking "a serious security crisis."

title: California man pleads guilty to selling more than $1 million of forged artwork
description: A California man pleaded guilty on Monday to selling more than $1.1 million of forged artwork between 2018 and 2020.
